children.subject: It worked for me, are you inputting  "Electrical Engineering" for subject and C128 for course number?

Yep, that worked. For some reason when I searched "Electrical Engineering" and set all course numbers greater than 100, it didn't show up with the rest of the courses. When I searched for it directly it worked. Thank you!

EE C128 is listed on the course catalog and in the Spring 2019 EECS course schedule, but doesn't show up in Calcentral either in the EE department or ME department (as C128 or C134). Is the class going to be offered for sure next semester, and if so can I add it to my schedule in Calcentral?
Update: I was able to enroll.

I am a standing sophomore (but a freshman in the normal sense) and I am technically undeclared ("intended CS major"). So I should qualify for either "College of Letters and Sciences: Freshman Students" or "College of Letters and Sciences: Undeclared Sophomore Students", both of which have open reserved seats. But I have been put on the waitlist. Is this a problem with the enrollment system or am I mistakenly somehow?

history.content:
Spring 2019 EE and EECS enrollment information:

Enrollment Priorities for EE16A and EE16B can be found on classes.berkeley.edu. At this time, we do not have plans to expand either class but we will update this post when we have more information.

  • If either one of these classes are required for you to graduate, we recommend you use Phase 1.

  • Once everyone has had their Phase 2 appointment, there will be no more enrollment priorities and the waitlist will process in order. If your lab fills while you’re waitlisted, the only way to switch it is to drop and re-add the class. This will put you at the bottom of the WL, but you cannot be enrolled into a full section. WL’d students with full labs will be skipped over when the WL processes automatically. Check classes.berkeley.edu for open labs before dropping and re-adding.

  • 1. UPDATE (10/15/18):  As of 3:13pm, EE16AB waitlist issues have been resolved.
  • 2.UPDATE (10/31/18): Time conflict errors have been reported when enrolling in 16A/B. We are currently working with campus to make sure this gets resolved. If you are experiencing this issue, please email ee-scheduling@eecs.berkeley.edu with the lab course number you are trying to enroll in.

EE and EECS upper-division classes: These classes still do not have enrollment priorities.

EE 16B: See classes.berkeley.edu for the labs schedule. Labs are 50 seats per section and are split into two enrollments. For example, Lab 115/115A occur at the same time, day, and location. You may enroll in either.

999 DIS Sections: Similarly to the CS side, EE16A and EE16B will have 999 discussion sections to facilitate enrollment. For EE16A and EE16B, you may be enrolled in one discussion section, but attend a different one. When adding this class you should choose the lecture, a lab section, and DIS 999. The schedules of DIS sections are visible on classes.berkeley.edu. You may attend any DIS section as long as there is a seat in the classroom. If the class is full, you will need to attend a different section. You must attend the lab section in which you are enrolled.

Switching Secondary Sections while Waitlisted: Dissimilar to the CS side, if you need to switch to another lab and/or dis section while waitlisted for an EE/EECS class, you still need to drop the class completely and re-add in order to switch.

  • If you are enrolled in a class, you should use the “Edit” feature in CalCentral to switch. Note if you choose a full secondary section, you will be bumped to the waitlist as you can only be enrolled into open sections.

Time Conflicts: The enrollment system will allow time conflicts between EE and EECS courses with other classes. It is still your responsibility to adhere to class attendance policies and check with the professor of the class regarding alternate midterm and final exam dates.

Enrollment Tips:

There must be an open seat in all parts of the class and you must meet enrollment priorities, if any, at the time of adding the class to be enrolled. E.g., if the class has lecture + lab + discussion, you have to be able to enroll in all 3 to be officially enrolled.

  • Unit limits: Phase I = 13.5 units, Phase II = 17.5, Adjustment Period = 20.5 These include waitlisted classes.

Q: I am waitlisted and my position went higher on the list, e.g. from 4 to 5. Why did this happen?

A: This is most likely due to an enrolled student switching from an open lab/discussion to a lab/discussion that is full. Since you cannot enroll into a full section, the enrolled student is bumped down to the waitlist at position #1, which shifts everyone down one. This is normal. If you see yourself, however, suddenly shift down many seats at once, this could be a bug. Please email ee-scheduling@eecs.berkeley.edu if you suddenly see yourself shift 10+ seats at once.

Enrollment drop-in hours will resume Jan 22nd - Feb 15th. Past these dates, schedule an appointment via email at ee-scheduling@eecs.berkeley.edu.

Time Conflicts: The enrollment system will allow time conflicts between EE and EECS courses with other classes. It is still your responsibility to adhere to class attendance policies and check with the professor of the class regarding alternate midterm and final exam dates.

Enrollment Tips:

  • Unit limits: Phase I = 13.5 units, Phase II = 17.5, Adjustment Period = 20.5 These include waitlisted classes.

Q: I am waitlisted and my position went higher on the list, e.g. from 4 to 5. Why did this happen?

A: This is most likely due to an enrolled student switching from an open lab/discussion to a lab/discussion that is full. If you see yourself, however, suddenly shift down many seats at once, this could be a bug. Please email ee-scheduling@eecs.berkeley.edu if you suddenly see yourself shift 10+ seats at once.

  • Once everyone has had their Phase 2 appointment, there will be no more enrollment priorities and the waitlist will process in order. If your lab fills while you’re waitlisted, the only way to switch it is to drop and re-add the class. This will put you at the bottom of the WL, but you cannot be enrolled into a full section. WL’d students with full labs will be skipped over when the WL processes automatically. Check classes.berkeley.edu for open labs before dropping and re-adding.

  • 1. UPDATE (10/15/18):  As of 3:13pm, EE16AB waitlist issues have been resolved.
  • 2.UPDATE (10/31/18): Time conflict errors have been reported when enrolling in 16A/B. We are currently working with campus to make sure this gets resolved. If you are experiencing this issue, please email ee-scheduling@eecs.berkeley.edu with the lab course number you are trying to enroll in.

EE and EECS upper-division classes: These classes still do not have enrollment priorities.

EE 16B: See classes.berkeley.edu for the labs schedule. Labs are 50 seats per section and are split into two enrollments. For example, Lab 115/115A occur at the same time, day, and location. You may enroll in either.

999 DIS Sections: Similarly to the CS side, EE16A and EE16B will have 999 discussion sections to facilitate enrollment. For EE16A and EE16B, you may be enrolled in one discussion section, but attend a different one. When adding this class you should choose the lecture, a lab section, and DIS 999. The schedules of DIS sections are visible on classes.berkeley.edu. You may attend any DIS section as long as there is a seat in the classroom. If the class is full, you will need to attend a different section. You must attend the lab section in which you are enrolled.

Switching Secondary Sections while Waitlisted: Dissimilar to the CS side, if you need to switch to another lab and/or dis section while waitlisted for an EE/EECS class, you still need to drop the class completely and re-add in order to switch.

  • If you are enrolled in a class, you should use the “Edit” feature in CalCentral to switch. Note if you choose a full secondary section, you will be bumped to the waitlist as you can only be enrolled into open sections.

Time Conflicts: The enrollment system will allow time conflicts between EE and EECS courses with other classes. It is still your responsibility to adhere to class attendance policies and check with the professor of the class regarding alternate midterm and final exam dates.

Enrollment Tips:

There must be an open seat in all parts of the class and you must meet enrollment priorities, if any, at the time of adding the class to be enrolled. E.g., if the class has lecture + lab + discussion, you have to be able to enroll in all 3 to be officially enrolled.

  • Unit limits: Phase I = 13.5 units, Phase II = 17.5, Adjustment Period = 20.5 These include waitlisted classes.

Q: I am waitlisted and my position went higher on the list, e.g. from 4 to 5. Why did this happen?

A: This is most likely due to an enrolled student switching from an open lab/discussion to a lab/discussion that is full. Since you cannot enroll into a full section, the enrolled student is bumped down to the waitlist at position #1, which shifts everyone down one. This is normal. If you see yourself, however, suddenly shift down many seats at once, this could be a bug. Please email ee-scheduling@eecs.berkeley.edu if you suddenly see yourself shift 10+ seats at once.

  • If you are enrolled in a class, you should use the “Edit” feature in CalCentral to switch. Note if you choose a full secondary section, you will be bumped to the waitlist as you can only be enrolled into open sections.

Time Conflicts: The enrollment system will allow time conflicts between EE and EECS courses with other classes. It is still your responsibility to adhere to class attendance policies and check with the professor of the class regarding alternate midterm and final exam dates.

Enrollment Tips:

There must be an open seat in all parts of the class and you must meet enrollment priorities, if any, at the time of adding the class to be enrolled. E.g., if the class has lecture + lab + discussion, you have to be able to enroll in all 3 to be officially enrolled.

  • Unit limits: Phase I = 13.5 units, Phase II = 17.5, Adjustment Period = 20.5 These include waitlisted classes.

Q: I am waitlisted and my position went higher on the list, e.g. from 4 to 5. Why did this happen?

A: This is most likely due to an enrolled student switching from an open lab/discussion to a lab/discussion that is full. Since you cannot enroll into a full section, the enrolled student is bumped down to the waitlist at position #1, which shifts everyone down one. This is normal. If you see yourself, however, suddenly shift down many seats at once, this could be a bug. Please email ee-scheduling@eecs.berkeley.edu if you suddenly see yourself shift 10+ seats at once.
